As illustrated in Fig. 5, and referring to the cubic structure for the sake of simplicity, a displacement of about 1.0 Å along one of the six [100] directions (towards the center of any of the cube faces) drives Eu 3+ from the regular dodecahedral Ba site, with O
h symmetry, to an acentric C
4v site, with approximate D
4d symmetry corresponding to a distorted 8-coordinated square antiprism.
